title: Lyrid meteor shower peaks April 22. Here's how to watch the night sky
description: Every year from January to mid-April, we experience a "meteor drought," without a single shower for months.

title: Pentagon extremism adviser lays out challenge facing military after two commanders deny a problem exists
description: One day after two four-star military commanders told Congress they did not have problems with extremists in their ranks, the top adviser on the issue to Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin took a different view and stated plainly that he believes the opposite.

title: The 10 Senate seats most likely to flip in 2022
description: Three months into President Joe Biden's term, the candidate fields are taking shape and the first early data is emerging about the fight for control of the chamber that will ultimately determine how successful he can be.

title: Why swearing is a sign of intelligence, helps manage pain and more
description: Polite society considers swearing to be a vulgar sign of low intelligence and education, for why would one rely on rude language when blessed with a rich vocabulary?

title: Ted Nugent contracts Covid-19 after saying 'it's not a real pandemic'
description: Singer Ted Nugent, who has repeatedly implied that Covid-19 is a hoax, now has the virus. He continued to downplay the rationale behind testing and vaccines.

title: How Minneapolis police first described the murder of George Floyd, and what we know now
How Minneapolis Police first described the murder of George Floyd, and what we know now
description: Photos: Verdict reactions | Timeline: Floyd's death

title: Apple made a big mistake with its new iMacs
description: Apple's new iMac is awesome: a technical marvel that culminates Apple's stunning engineering achievements over the past several years. It's also ugly as sin.

title: Trump's dominance spells trouble for the GOP
description: Others have said it, but since top Republicans haven't taken it to heart, the message bears repeating: With all due respect, you've got to quit Donald Trump. For your own sake, and the country's, cancel your reservations at Mar-a-Lago. Block his number. And whatever you do, don't fall for any of his old tricks.

title: Why a longtime president died at the hands of rebels on a battlefield
description: It's not often that a President travels to the frontlines of his army's clashes with rebels. Idriss Deby, the 68-year old President of Chad did and paid with his life.

title: Derek Chauvin is in a prison's segregated housing unit for his safety while he awaits sentencing
description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was put into a prison's restricted housing unit for his own safety, a prison spokesperson said, after Chauvin was found guilty of the murder of George Floyd on Tuesday.

title: UK space agency hunts for 'moon trees' grown from seeds that went on Apollo 14 lunar mission
description: Fifty years ago, NASA's Apollo 14 completed the third crewed mission to the moon. On board the spacecraft as it landed in the Pacific Ocean on February 9, 1971, was some unusual cargo -- about 500 tree seeds.

title: 90-year-old woman loses $32 million in phone scam
description: Hong Kong police have arrested a man after a 90-year-old woman lost around HK$247 million ($32 million) in a scam.

title: Van Jones reacts to Justice Department's Minneapolis police probe
description: CNN's Van Jones reacts to Attorney General Merrick Garland's announcement that the Justice Department has launched a federal civil investigation into policing practices in Minneapolis following the death of George Floyd and the murder convictions for ex-cop Derek Chauvin.

title: Holding the line against Russia in Ukraine
description: Russia's menacing troop build-up near Ukraine's border and in our Crimean region in recent days is the latest reminder to our allies of the ongoing campaign of coercion, intimidation and escalation to which Ukrainians have unfortunately become accustomed.

title: Late Spanish dictator's family can keep valuable artifacts sought by state, court rules
description: A Spanish court has ruled that the family of the late dictator General Francisco Franco is entitled to keep a treasure trove of artifacts claimed by the state.

title: I now know what caused my autism, which changes everything — and nothing
description: Life-changing news came on a Thursday just before Christmas, in an email so unexpected I nearly deleted it as spam. The subject line: "We have found a genetic cause for your autism."

title: Dark tourism takes to the sky above Chernobyl
description: If you've ever dreamed of seeing the site of the world's worst nuclear disaster from the air, now may be your chance.

title: Queen thanks well-wishers as she spends her first birthday without Prince Philip
description: Queen Elizabeth II is marking her 95th birthday in a low-key fashion at Windsor Castle, just days after the funeral of Prince Philip, her husband of 73 years.

title: Ex-Reddit CEO Ellen Pao: This is the biggest myth about working in tech
description: The "biggest myth" about working in the tech industry is that it's based on a meritocracy.

title: See the extraordinary moments camerawoman captured
description: For nearly 40 years, CNN photojournalist Mary Rogers has covered breaking news around the world. For her, one particular experience stands out -- filming a momentous rally in the early days of the 2011 uprising in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Protesters upstage Tesla at China's top auto show
description: Tesla has been swept up in yet another controversy in China, even as the company tries to win new customers there with cars it says will be tailor-made to match their preferences.

title: Sport world reacts to Chauvin conviction: 'We have a long way to go'
description: The sports world is reacting to the conviction of Derek Chauvin in the killing of George Floyd with sighs of relief but also with warning of the long journey ahead to justice.

title: Singer Ezra Furman reveals she is a trans woman and a mother
description: Musician Ezra Furman has revealed she is a trans woman and a mother, telling fans she is "very proud" to "have come to know it and be able to say it."

title: Here are the sentences Chauvin could face after guilty verdict
description: CNN's Elie Honig explains how much time former police officer Derek Chauvin, 45, could face after he was convicted of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter in the case of George Floyd.

title: Super League to amend plans for elite tournament after English teams say they won't participate
description: The architects of the European Super League appeared to strike a defiant tone Tuesday, promising to "reshape the project" following the withdrawal of all six English clubs from the controversial breakaway competition.

title: Floyd's family responds to Chauvin trial verdict
description: George Floyd's brothers shared their pain and grief with the world for nearly a year. On Tuesday, they finally felt some relief.

title: America at a crossroads after Chauvin guilty verdict
description: The conviction of Derek Chauvin showed George Floyd's life really did matter to a justice system on trial.

title: Dalai Lama and 100 other Nobel Prize laureates call for fossil fuels to be phased out
description: As the world's most powerful leaders prepare to come together for the President Joe Biden's virtual climate summit, the Dalai Lama and 100 other Nobel Prize winners have a clear message for them: Keep fossil fuels in the ground.

title: These are the jeans women REALLY need
description: For more than 10 years, manufacturers tell us, American women shopping for jeans have overwhelmingly reached for the "skinny" kind, those body conscious pants designed to outline our shapes from waist to ankle -- with all the potential for discomfort that women know well and everyone else can just imagine.

title: Bernice King draws historical parallel on the Chauvin verdict
description: Speaking to CNN's Don Lemon, Bernice King, CEO of the King Center and daughter of the civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr., reacts to the verdict in Derek Chauvin's trial.

title: Poor sleep nearly doubles risk of sexual dysfunction in women, study says
description: Consistently getting a bad night's sleep may lead to an unsatisfactory sex life for many older women, a new study finds.

title: Suspected Chinese hackers exploited Pulse Secure VPN to compromise 'dozens' of agencies and companies
description: For months, hackers with suspected ties to China have exploited a popular workplace tool to break into government agencies, defense companies and financial institutions in the US and Europe, according to a report by the cybersecurity firm FireEye.

title: Reporter: Attorney couldn't snap Chauvin out of his gaze
description: CNN's Josh Campbell describes the tense moment inside the court room as Judge Peter Cahill read out the guilty verdict in Derek Chauvin's murder trial.

title: Sicknick death ruled 'natural' but experts say stress can set off strokes
description: Were the strokes that killed US Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick after the January 6 insurrection really natural? Some neurologists don't think so.

title: Shopper spots snake slithering across cans of beans at Target
description: Shopper shoots video of a snake slithering across cans of beans at Target. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.
